content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with Max Müller from Germany.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for a newly built, unfurnished one-bedroom apartment in the city center.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price. Max Müller terminated the negotiation because he could not afford the price I was asking, which was closer to the market value of 750 Euro.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price. Max Müller terminated the negotiation because he could not afford the price I was asking, which was closer to the market value of 750 Euro.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: As Peter Schmidt, I would rate Max Müller's likeability as a negotiation partner as a 7. He was respectful, transparent about his budget, and willing to negotiate. However, he ultimately could not meet the market value of the apartment, which led to the termination of the negotiation.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. Max Müller conducted himself professionally and expressed his intentions and budget honestly. The negotiation ended amicably, with Max acknowledging the value of the apartment and wishing me luck in finding a suitable tenant.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: N/A: I did not feel discriminated or offended during the negotiation. The conversation was respectful and straightforward, and Max Müller's decision to terminate the negotiation was based on his budget constraints, not personal or discriminatory reasons.
name: Peter Schmidt
